meanings.definition: Raw material used as input in an industrial process.
meanings.sent1: The factory relies on various feedstocks to make their products.
meanings.sent2: The farmer grows different feedstocks to sell to the local businesses.
meanings.sent3: The feedstocks had a party in the warehouse, waiting to be turned into something useful.
meanings.sent4: The feedstocks danced together in the production line, transforming into finished goods.
meanings.sent5: The feedstocks lined up, ready to be transformed into something new and valuable.

meanings.definition: Materials or substances that are used to produce energy or fuel.
meanings.sent1: The power plant requires specific feedstocks to generate electricity.
meanings.sent2: The biofuel industry is always looking for sustainable feedstocks.
meanings.sent3: The feedstocks whispered to each other, excited to become energy sources.
meanings.sent4: The feedstocks glowed brightly as they were converted into fuel for the cars.
meanings.sent5: The feedstocks hummed with energy, ready to power the entire city.
